page.title: 11Betty Haunt Lane,Park Cross.
page.content: The curiously named Betty Haunt Lane runs 1.5 kilometres through our area. The lane is said to have been named after Betty, a smuggler's daughter who lived two centuries ago.It is said she helped the smugglers by entertaining the Customs officers while they crept past with the goods.But one day Betty fell in love with one of the customs men and told him all the smugglers secrets.Most smugglers were captured, but some escaped to return to strangle Betty, whose spirit is said to haunt the lane.It may simply be that the name 'haunt' derives from a dialect word for a horse or cattle pound. The nearby 400 year old public house the Blacksmith's Arms is also claimed to be haunted, having been the scene of two murders this century.Two 18th. century Admiralty cottages in the lane,may have housed customs officers.
